column22: To the shareholder of Delia A/S
column25: The annual report is prepared in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column26: In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and fair view of the company's financial position at 31 December 2016 and of the results of the company's operations for the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2016.
column30: On initial recognition, foreign currency transactions are translated applying the exchange rate at the transaction date. Foreign-exchange differences arising between the exchange rates at the transaction date and at the date of payment are recognised in the income statement as financial income or financial expenses.
column31: Cash consist of bank deposits and cash at bank and in hand.
column32: Other external expenses include expenses related to distribution, sale, advertising, administration, premises, bad debts, payments under operating leases, etc.
column33: Financial income and expenses are recognised in the income statement at the amounts relating to the financial year. Net financials include interest income and expenses, financial expenses relating to finance leases, realised and unrealised capital/exchange gains and losses on securities and foreign currency transactions, amortisation of mortgage loans and surcharges and allowances under the advance-payment-of-tax scheme, etc.
column34: Liabilities are measured at amortised cost equal to nominal value.
column35: Receivables are measured at amortised cost. Write-downs for bad debt are based on individual assesment of receivables.
column36: Income from sale of charter hours.
column37: Tax for the year, which comprises the current tax charge for the year and changes in the deferred tax charge, including changes arising from changes in tax rates, is recognised in the income statement as regards the portion that relates to entries directly in equity.
column38: We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark. Our responsibilities under those standards and requirements are further described in the âAuditor's responsibilities for the audit of the financial statementsâ section of our report. We are independent of the company in accordance with the International Ethics Standards Board for Accountants' Code of Ethics for Professional Accountants (IESBA Code) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.
column39: The Company has not assumed any liabilities, in excess of the liabilities resultning from its ordinary business.
column47: The supervisory and executive boards have today discussed and approved the annual report of Delia A/S for the financial year 1 January - 31 December 2016.
column50: In our opinion, management's review includes a fair review of the matters dealt with in the management's review.
column67: Management recommends that the annual report should be approved at the annual general meeting.

Foreign-exchange differences arising between the exchange rates at the transaction date and at the date of payment are recognised in the income statement as financial income or financial expenses.
column31: Cash consist of bank deposits and cash at bank and in hand.
column32: Other external expenses include expenses related to distribution, sale, advertising, administration, premises, bad debts, payments under operating leases, etc.
column33: Financial income and expenses are recognised in the income statement at the amounts relating to the financial year. Net financials include interest income and expenses, financial expenses relating to finance leases, realised and unrealised capital/exchange gains and losses on securities and foreign currency transactions, amortisation of mortgage loans and surcharges and allowances under the advance-payment-of-tax scheme, etc.
column34: Liabilities are measured at amortised cost equal to nominal value.
column35: Receivables are measured at amortised cost. Write-downs for bad debt are based on individual assesment of receivables.
column36: Income from sale of charter hours.
column37: Tax for the year, which comprises the current tax charge for the year and changes in the deferred tax charge, including changes arising from changes in tax rates, is recognised in the income statement as regards the portion that relates to entries directly in equity.
